This tapas place is just off the busy Las Rambalas in a quiet street.  The amount of lovely looking tapas lined the counters.  We had a very good glass of house white wine at 4 euros with 5 tapas.  We had the salmon with tuna tapa which was very fresh and the olives with anchovies has a right combination of saltiness.  The cure ham on a mini baguette was only okay as you tasted more of the bread than the ham.  The best one one was hands down a dessert-like tapa with cream and magenta raspberry sauce on top.  It tasted like a great ice cream!  Every tapa was 1.95 euro and olive one was only 1 euro. They tallied up by the toothpicks.  A great place for tasty and reasonable tapas amongst a tourist area!
